entries.title: EU wants passengers from China to take pre-flight Covid-19 test
entries.description: China has already vehemently rejected such actions, warning of 'countermeasures' if such policies were to be imposed across the bloc.

entries.title: Covid-19 in China: In the streets of Ruili, the most restricted city in the country
entries.description: Inhabitants of this city on the border with Myanmar city are waiting impatiently for the borders to reopen. The city has experienced more than a dozen lockdowns over three years, each lasting several weeks.

entries.title: Macron promises Zelensky combat tanks to repel Russian invasion
entries.description: Earlier on Wednesday, Russian President Vladimir Putin presided over the launch of a warship armed with new hypersonic cruise missiles on an international training mission.

entries.title: French political parties flirt with bakers in light of inflation
entries.description: Hit by a significant increase in electricity prices, bakers are mobilizing. The far right's Rassemblement National has offered them its support and the government has announced new subsidies.

entries.title: Republican McCarthy loses his bid for House speaker for a fourth time
entries.description: The new Republican-led US House of Representatives was engulfed in crisis for a second day running Wednesday after a fresh round of voting failed to produce a winner in the race for speaker.

entries.title: Iranian actress Taraneh Alidoosti released on bail after almost three weeks in jail
entries.description: The star's December 17 arrest for supporting anti-government protests prompted shock across the country.

entries.title: UK PM Sunak pledges to halve inflation, grow economy, stop illegal immigration
entries.description: In his speech outlining priorities for 2023, the British PM said he wanted to 'rebuild trust in politics through action, or not at all.'

entries.title: 'Very much a political policy': Canada's ban on foreigners buying real estate for two years
entries.description: Foreign investors are thought to be partly responsible for skyrocketing housing prices in the country's major cities in recent years. But some experts say the ban is unlikely to significantly help Canadians with their purchases.

entries.title: German minister of defense in hot water after bizarre new year wishes
entries.description: Criticized even in her own camp, Christine Lambrecht has repeatedly blundered and not succeeded in establishing her authority over the Bundeswehr.

entries.title: Why is the al-Aqsa Mosque compound such a flashpoint site?
entries.description: At the risk of aggravating tensions, Israel's new national security minister visited the epicenter of the Israeli-Palestinian conflict, Islam's third holiest site and Judaism's most sacred site.

entries.title: Flu epidemic in France is strong, but not exceptional, numbers show
entries.description: The number of cases of flu exploded in December 2022 across the country, overtaking covid cases in ICUs as French hospitals struggle to cope with increased demand in light of staff shortages.

entries.title: Meta fined €390 after advertising practices ruled illegal under EU law
entries.description: Meta has kicked off off the New Year with more privacy fines and corrective orders hitting its business in Europe.

entries.title: At the final farewell to King Pelé in Santos: 'A special moment we will never forget'
entries.description: The Brazilian footballer was buried on Tuesday in the city of his first club after 24 hour-long funeral vigil. President Lula came to pay his respects.

entries.title: Republicans tear each other apart over US House speaker appointment
entries.description: Kevin McCarthy failed to be elected by his party on Tuesday after three rounds of voting, a first in a century.

entries.title: Paris shooting: Prosecutor defends handling of suspect's previous sword attack on migrant camp
entries.description: The treatment of the case of the sword attack in a camp in Paris by the presumed perpetrator of the racist shooting spree in Paris had raised questions. Rémy Heitz declares 'it is always difficult to re-read the facts after the fact.'

entries.title: North and South Korea start the year in a tense game of confrontation
entries.description: Seoul's leaders are sharpening their tone after Pyongyang's decision to develop its nuclear arsenal.

entries.title: Somalia: Twin car bombings claimed by al-Shabaab kill at least 19
entries.description: Al-Shabaab has intensified attacks against civilian and military targets as Somalia's recently elected government has pursued a policy of 'all-out war' against the Islamists.

entries.title: 'Sexual violence' or 'abuse?' The Church's debate over words
entries.description: The growing number of scandals has led to a semantic controversy over how best to refer to them.

entries.title: Lionel Messi returns to Paris hoping for victor's welcome
entries.description: The striker arrived in the capital on Tuesday, January 3 in the capital, a fortnight after his World Cup victory with Argentina.

entries.title: Climatologist Robert Vautard: 'Since the end of 2022, we have been experiencing record-breaking temperatures'
entries.description: Like the extreme weather during the summer of 2022, the current unseasonably mild weather is caused by climate change, explained the scientist.

entries.title: Israel: Itamar Ben-Gvir plays with fire by visiting al-Aqsa Mosque compound
entries.description: With the approval of Prime Minister Benyamin Netanyahu, the far-right politician orchestrated a visit to this highly sensitive holy site in Jerusalem as a show of force.

entries.title: US to authorize selling abortion pills at retail pharmacies
entries.description: Demand for abortion pills has risen since the US Supreme Court made a landmark ruling to overturn Roe v. Wade in June last year.

entries.title: Boulangeries in knead: French government rolls out energy aid for bakers
entries.description: Impacted by rising energy prices, bakeries are set to receive emergency aid from the French government – which wants the dough to keep rising, not electricity bills.

entries.title: Ex-archbishop of Paris under investigation over 'sexual assault'
entries.description: Michel Aupetit resigned in 2021 after reports of an intimate relationship with a woman. Prosecutors are now looking into allegations of sexual assault on a vulnerable person under judicial protection.

entries.title: France's triple Olympic steeplechase medalist Mahiedine Mekhissi retires
entries.description: The cross-country runner one of few who could keep up with the discipline's Kenyan specialists.

entries.title: Myanmar to free 7,000 prisoners for Independence day
entries.description: The announcement by the country's ruling junta comes days after a court extended Nobel laureate and civilian leader Aung San Suu Kyi's jail term to 33 years.

entries.title: Tesla, Apple shares keep dragging down Wall Street
entries.description: Technology stocks fell for their first trading day of 2023 following a 2022 'annus horribilis', still suffering from an interest rate hike decided by the US Federal Reserve last month.

entries.title: Tanella Boni: 'The French aren't ready to rethink their perception of Africa'
entries.description: 'From Dakar to Djibouti, a tour of the Africa-France relationship' (5/11). The Ivorian writer calls for 'balanced' relations, free of condescension, racism and prejudice.

entries.title: Plenty of rain, little snow: A difficult start to the season for French ski resorts
entries.description: During the school break, mountain resorts were affected by a lack of snow. Some had to close their lifts.

entries.title: 'Back to the future in the automotive industry'
entries.description: In France, since 2020, the sector seems to be reliving the 70s, especially the low level of sales. On the eve of 2023, it faces three major challenges: economic, ecological and societal, writes columnist Philippe Escande.

entries.title: Actor Jeremy Renner was hurt in a 'tragic accident,' investigation continues
entries.description: The sheriff said Tuesday there were no signs of foul play or any indication Mr. Renner was impaired at the time of the Sunday morning incident, while he was using a snow tractor to free a snowbound motorist on a private road near Lake Tahoe.

entries.title: Czech industrial model shaken by energy crisis
entries.description: Heavily dependent on the automotive sector, cheap energy and Germany, the Czech economy will experience one of the biggest slowdowns in Eastern Europe in 2023.

entries.title: US says Venezuela President Maduro is still illegitimate
entries.description: The US said Tuesday it would maintain sanctions after the fledgling opposition dissolved its 'interim government.' Joined by most Western and Latin American nations, Washington recognized Juan Guaido as interim president four years ago.

entries.title: Brooklyn subway shooter pleads guilty
entries.description: Frank James pleaded guilty to all 11 counts in his indictment, including 10 counts of committing a terrorist attack against a mass transit system in Brooklyn federal court. 10 passengers were wounded in April 2022.

entries.title: Idaho murders suspect agrees to extradition to face charges
entries.description: Bryan Kohberger, a 28-year-old doctoral student, will be transported to Idaho within 10 days. He is accused of killing four students in November.

entries.title: When 'Rolling Stone' omits Céline Dion from its list of top artists, Quebec is outraged
entries.description: The singer with 200 million records sold does not appear in the ranking of the American magazine's "200 greatest singers of all time."

entries.title: French study shows that paternity leave reduces the risk of postpartum depression in fathers
entries.description: Approximately 8-10% of men are affected by postpartum depression. A pathology that can manifest itself through anger, irritability, and even alcohol or drug use.
